Toothpaste is like our words - easy to come out and extremely difficult to put back in. Miss Riddle's students were given a tub of toothpaste and asked to squeeze it out as fast as they could. They were then given a toothpick and asked to put the toothpaste back in the tube. They quickly found that this was almost impossible! This could be a good lesson for all of us.
Pictured: London Key, Sloane Crump, Zaniya Brown and Gavin Wragge.

post_text: Hubbard Elementary would like to welcome Coach Kent Fuller to the Jaguar Family! Coach Fuller will be teaching P.E. this year and has been named Head Boys' Basketball Coach. 1. Each Graduate will receive 10 on-field arm bands. Each individual graduates row will have 2 sets of 5 chairs separated by by 6 feet.

Please help us congratulate and celebrate our amazing class of 2020 this Friday, June 5, 2020 at 8 pm.

Thank you,

This is our week to honor the incredible team of teachers that we are so blessed to have at Hubbard ISD. Although this week and spring are different, the amazing work you do for our students does not go unnoticed We truly appreciate the dedication and love that our teachers demonstrate every day.

We are fortunate every single day to observe Hubbard ISD teachers dedication to the success of each and every child. They provide hope to the children of our community. They provide stability in attitude and attention to every detail of a child’s life and they understand the profound influence they have on the lives of kids. Hubbard ISD'S teachers are meaningful partners in the raising of our community’s children.

It is our privilege to extend a heartfelt message of gratitude for the work that our teachers do. It is true that teaching is a calling, not a profession, and we am so honored that our teachers have chosen Hubbard ISD as a place to make a difference in the lives of others.

Thank you,

Hubbard ISD Administration

In Hubbard we compete hard in academics, athletics, and anything else you can think of involved with Hubbard Secondary. However, there is one thing that makes us very unique that puts us above all other schools that I have ever been a part of. This is our students. Here at the Hubbard Secondary, our students have a big heart and a willingness to put others before them. They also encourage, love, care, support, guide, and will even carry you if needed. These pictures from yesterday's cross country meet does not do full justice of what our kids truly do and how they are on a regular basis.
Seen in the pictures our some of our JV and Varsity girls running with a middle school girl to encourage her. These young ladies ran about a mile or so back in the trail to help encourage this girl and then talked to her, walked beside her, and ran with her until she finished. Great job, ladies. We are proud of you. This little girl needed ya'll and came through. WE are Hubbard and WE are Family. #secondaryfamily4life #encourage #support #nevergiveup #standtogether
